issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: The issue is open and ready for the assignee to start work on it.
status.name: Open

fields.description:
If multiple clients attempt to access/initialize the Hive Metastore at the same time they can fail due to error "Table 'metastore_DELETEME1347565995856' doesn't exist". A common scenario where this could happen is if there is a central mysql metastore and clients from multiple machines attempt to read from the metastore at the same time. This is outside of a standalone Hive Server install scenario. 

I believe this is not actually a Hive bug, but instead a Data Nucleus issue.

fields.summary: Simultaneous attempts to initialize the Hive Metastore can fail due to error "Table 'metastore_DELETEME1347565995856' doesn't exist"

comments.body:
Ed reported encountering this problem in an email to hive-user list:

http://mail-archives.apache.org/mod_mbox/hive-user/201107.mbox/%3C4F6B25AFFFCAFE44B6259A412D5F9B1033183876@ExchMBX104.netflix.com%3E

He noted that in some cases it's possible to prevent this error by setting datanucleus.fixedDataStore=true.
